name: HIDDEN_LAYERS
description: An intercepted image contains hidden data using LSB steganography. Extract the flag from the image file.
author: AegisForge Security Team

hints.content: The flag is encoded in binary and hidden in the LSB (Least Significant Bit) of each pixel's RGB values.
Try using tools like 'zsteg' or write a Python script with PIL to extract the LSB from each color channel.
Extract bits from RGB channels in order, group them into bytes, and decode as ASCII. The flag starts at the beginning of the LSB data.

learning_objectives: Learn to use steganography analysis tools
